name: 呂良賜
objective:
國合專題特論乃透過國際大師的講課，讓學生學習有機及高分子材料相關領域的重要知識及了解最先進之研究成果或最新開發成品。
This course will provide important information regarding to the latest development or application on the organic and polymeric materials. Speakers being invited are well-known international scholars in the related area.

A graduate-level course covering the topics of analytical spectroscopies. Examples from modern chemical
research will be discussed to illustrate the basic concepts and instrumentation of analytical spectroscopies. This
course is an elective course for chemistry graduate students in either the M.S. or the Ph.D. program.
There is no required text for this course. The following books may be used as references:
Instrumental Analysis, R. M. Granger, et al (2017); Modern spectroscopy, 4th Ed., J. M. Hollas (2004); Basic
atomic and molecular spectroscopy, J. M. Hollas (2002); Spectra of atoms and molecules, P. F. Bernath (1995).
Slides for the lectures will be distributed to students after the classes.
schedule:
10/5 1 3 Development & applications of nanoparticles with unique optical properties
10/6 2 3 Interaction between EM radiation with molecules
10/11 3 3 Electronic spectroscopy: UV-vis; AA; AES; Fluorescence
10/13 4 3 Electronic spectroscopy: UV-vis; AA; AES; Fluorescence
10/16 5 3 IR & Raman;
10/17 6 3 Mass spectrometry
